Structs/DKResponseListAny.html#/s:11Drop.name: list(from:withRepresentation:)
Structs/DKResponseListAny.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Serializes a list of new objects (of DKCollection, DKItem, DKReaction, DKComment, or DKInvite types) from the provided network response and key-value representation. The representation is validated for the required list.

Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.name: statusCode
Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.abstract: The network status code of the error response

Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.name: identifier
Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.abstract: The string identifer of the server error

Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.name: message
Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.abstract: The message the server returned with the error

Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.name: init(response:data:)
Structs/DKServerError.html#/s:11Dropmark.abstract: Initialize an error from the server response.

Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.name: collectionID
Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.abstract: The unique identifier of the destination collection

Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.name: stackID
Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.abstract: The unique identifier of the destination stack, if available

Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.name: init(collection:stack:)
Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.abstract: Create a destination aimed at a specific collection and stack

Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.name: init(collectionID:stackID:)
Structs/DKDirectory.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.abstract: Create a destination aimed at a specific collection and stack

Structs/DKServerError.html.name: DKServerError
Structs/DKServerError.html.abstract: An error returned from the Dropmark API

Structs/DKResponseListAny.html.name: DKResponseListAny
Structs/DKResponseListAny.html.abstract: Similar to DKResponseListSerializable, the DKResponseListAny is a serializer that generates an array of objects of any type. This extension is useful when handling results from Dropmark’s /activity endpoint, which returns a variety of object types.

Protocols/DKResponseObjectSerializable.h.name: init(response:representation:)
Protocols/DKResponseObjectSerializable.h.abstract: Serializes a new instance from the provided network response and key-value representation. The representation is validated for the required parameters, then fills in optional parameters as necessary.

Protocols/DKResponseListSerializable.htm.name: list(from:withRepresentation:)
Protocols/DKResponseListSerializable.htm.abstract: Serializes a list of new objects (of a specified type) from the provided network response and key-value representation. The representation is validated for the required list.

Protocols/DKResponseListSerializable.htm.name: DKResponseListSerializable
Protocols/DKResponseListSerializable.htm.abstract: When applied to classes in Dropmark’s model, a class conforming to DKResponseListSerializable can be serialized from JSON into an array of objects.

Protocols/DKResponseObjectSerializable.h.name: DKResponseObjectSerializable
Protocols/DKResponseObjectSerializable.h.abstract: When applied to classes in Dropmark’s model, a class conforming to DKResponseObjectSerializable can serialize JSON into an object instance.

Functions.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK2eeoiySbA.abstract: Returns whether the two collections are equal.
Returns whether the two comments are equal.
Returns whether the two invites are equal.
Returns whether the two items are equal.
Returns whether the two users are equal.

Extensions/DataRequest.html#/s:9Alamofir.name: promiseObject()
Extensions/DataRequest.html#/s:9Alamofir.abstract: Generate a CancellablePromise from a DataRequest, returning an object of the inferred type.

Extensions/DataRequest.html#/s:9Alamofir.name: promiseList()
Extensions/DataRequest.html#/s:9Alamofir.abstract: Generate a CancellablePromise from a DataRequest, returning a list of objects of the inferred type.

Extensions/DataRequest.html#/s:9Alamofir.name: promiseListAny()
Extensions/DataRequest.html#/s:9Alamofir.abstract: Generate a CancellablePromise from a DataRequest, returning a list of objects of any type.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: baseURLString
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: The domain and path for all endpoints on the Dropmark API. Defaults to “https://api.dropmark.com/v1”, and may be modified for different API versions.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: pageSize
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: The number of objects to list per page request. Defaults to 24

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: activity(parameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of the most recently updated items across a user’s teams and personal accounts. Returns a DKItem list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: authenticate(parameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Pass in an email and password, and get a user object containing the token necessary to authenticate requests on behalf of the user. Returns a DKUser object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listCollections(queryParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of collections. Returns a DKCollection list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createCollection(bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Create a collection. Returns a DKCollection object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getCollection(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a single collection. Returns a DKCollection object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateCollection(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update a single collection. Returns a DKCollection object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteCollection(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Delete a single collection. Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getCollectionsCount
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get the total number of collections available to the user. Returns an integer.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getItemsCountForCollection(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get the total number of items in a collection. Returns an integer.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listCollaboratorsInCollection(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of users with permission to access the collection. Returns a DKUser list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: addCollaboratorToCollection(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Give a user access to a collection (only works if the current user has permission)

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: removeCollaboratorFromCollection(userID:collectionID:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Remove a user’s access to a collection (only works if the current user has permission). Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listCommentsForItem(itemID:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of comments associated with an item. Returns a DKComment list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createCommentForItem(itemID:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Add a comment to an item. Returns a DKComment object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateComment(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update a comment. Returns a DKComment object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteComment(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Delete a comment. Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listEmails
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of emails associated with the current user. Returns a String list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createEmail(email:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Add an email for the current user

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteEmail(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Delete an email for the current user

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listItems(queryParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of all items matching the query parameters. Returns a DKItem list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listItemsInCollection(id:queryParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of all child items in a collection (adding a parent_id will filter in a stack). Returns a DKItem list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createItemInCollection(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Create a new item in a parent collection. Returns a DKItem object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateItemsInCollection(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update multiple items within a collection. Returns a DKItem list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateItems(bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update multiple items. Returns a DKItem list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getItem(id:queryParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a single item. Returns a DKItem object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateItem(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update a single item. Returns a DKItem object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteItem(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Delete a single item. Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteItemsInCollection(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Delete multiple items within a parent collection. Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: copyItems(bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Duplicate an item(s) within a parent collection. Returns a DKItem list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listReactionsForItem(itemID:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of reactions associated with an item. Returns a DKReaction list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createReactionForItem(itemID:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Create a reaction for an item. Returns a DKReaction object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteReaction(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Delete a reaction. Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: search(queryParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Run a search for collections, items, comments, reactions, and invites using the q parameter. Note: Be sure to use the DKResponseListAny serializer to accept varying object types. Returns a list containing ‘DKCollection’, ‘DKItem’, ‘DKComment’, ‘DKReaction’, and ‘DKInvite’ objects.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listTags
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of tags associated with the current user. Returns a DKTag list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listTagsForItem(itemID:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of tags applied to the specified item. Returns a DKTag list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createTagForItem(itemID:name:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Create a new tag and apply it to the specified item. Returns a DKTag object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteTag(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Delete a tag. Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listTeams(queryParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of teams the current user belongs to. Returns a DKTeam list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getTeam(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a specified team, if visible to the current user. Returns a DKTeam object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateTeam(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update a team. Returns a DKTeam object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listUsersInTeam(id:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: List all users belonging to the specified team. Returns a DKUser list.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createUserInTeam(id:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Add a user to a team. Returns a DKUser object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateUserInTeam(teamID:userID:bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update a user within a team. Returns a DKUser object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: deleteUserInTeam(teamID:userID:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Remove a user from a team. Returns only a 200 response.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createUser(bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Create a user (aka register a new account). Returns a DKUser object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getUser(queryParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get the user object for the current user. NOTE: The user object returned by this endpoint will not contain a ‘token’ for authentication. Returns a DKUser object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: updateUser(bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Update information for the current user. Returns a DKUser object.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: listContacts
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Get a list of users associated with the current user

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getEmailAvailability(email:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Check if an email is available for registration. Returns a Bool value.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: getUsernameAvailability(username:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Check if a username is available for registration. Returns a Bool value.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: createUploadSignature(bodyParameters:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Use this endpoint to get an upload signature for direct uploads to Amazon S3

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: asURLRequest()
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: Returns a URL request or throws if an Error was encountered.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: authenticateAPIRequest(_:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: To access API resources, an API token is required in the header of all requests. To authenticate with this function, first set the DKRouter.apiToken variable. Then pass a reference to a request through.

Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.name: authorizeUserRequest(_:)
Enums/DKRouter.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK8DKR.abstract: To authorize requests on behalf of a user, the user’s private token must be encoded and supplied in the Authorization header. To authorize a user’s request for the duration of the app session, set an authenticated user to DKRouter.user.

Enums/DKPlan.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKPla.name: proBeta
Enums/DKPlan.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKPla.abstract: All personal Dropmark features, plus beta features

Enums/DKPlan.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKPla.name: proMonthly
Enums/DKPlan.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKPla.abstract: All personal Dropmark features, paid on a monthly basis

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: image
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: Represents a data file such as a JPEG, PNG, or HEIC image.

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: video
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: Represents a data file such as a MPEG, MP4, or MOV video.

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: audio
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: Represents a data file such as a MP3, AAC, or WAV audio file.

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: link
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: Represents a string conforming to a URL scheme.

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: stack
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: Special case item that behaves as a parent to other items.

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: other
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: An item not conforming to any of the other item types. Oftentimes this is a data file in a proprietary format, such as a Sketch or Photoshop file.

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: init(mimeType:)
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: Derive a Dropmark item type from a file’s MIME type (such as “image/jpeg”).

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: init(filenameExtension:)
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: Derive a Dropmark item type from a filename extension (like “jpg”).

Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.name: displayTitle
Enums/DKItemType.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK10.abstract: String useful for displaying an item type on screen. Returns a capitalized version of the case value, except for .other, which returns “File”

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: paginationDidReachEnd
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: The pagination object reached the end of the object list

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: paginationIsFetchingPage
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: The pagination object is currently in the process of getting a new page of objects

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: unableToSerializeJSON
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: The incoming JSON is in an unexpected format

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: unableToSerializeItem
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: An error occurred while trying to create an object from the network response

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: missingAPIToken
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: An API token is missing from the DKRouter.user property

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: missingUser
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: A user object is needed but not present

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: missingUserToken
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: A user token is needed but not present

Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.name: requestIsNil
Enums/DKError.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK7DKEr.abstract: Request was deallocated from memory before a response could be returned

Enums/DKError.html.name: DKError
Enums/DKError.html.abstract: Errors associated with points of failure in the SDK

Enums/DKItemType.html.name: DKItemType
Enums/DKItemType.html.abstract: High-level item representations handled by Dropmark. Item types are expressed as strings, and are thus comparable and printable. Item types, Universal Type Identifers, MIMEs, and file extensions are tightly integrated in the Dropmark SDK.

Enums/DKRouter.html.name: DKRouter
Enums/DKRouter.html.abstract: Route network traffic across all supported API endpoints for Dropmark

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: next
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Required - Set this closure to process a single page of results, and return your request packaged in a CancellablePromiseKit promise. A single page is requested and returned in the promise format. By calling getNext(), this closure will be used.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: pageSize
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: The number of items in a single page request. This integer is used to calculate when a list endpoint reaches the end.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: didReachEnd
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Test if pagination loaded all objects from the list.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: isFetchingPage
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Test if pagination is in the process of retrieving a page.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: init(startPage:)
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Initialize a pagination object, beginning with the specified startPage. DKPaginationGenerator retrieves items of a generic Type, so a placeholder Type is required to specify what kinds of objects will be paginated and returned.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: getNext()
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Get the next page of results as outlined in the next closure.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: reset()
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Cancel the current pagination request, if one exists, then reset pagination back to the original startPage

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: shouldGetNextPage(at:for:)
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Trigger utility to determine if a user scrolled to the end of a UICollectionView. We recommend using this function in your UICollectionViewDelegate collectionView(_:willDisplay:forItemAt:) method to determine if you should call your getNext() promise.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.name: shouldGetNextPage(at:for:)
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: Trigger utility to determine if a user scrolled to the end of a UITableView. We recommend using this function in your UITableViewDelegate tableView(_:willDisplay:forRowAt:) method to determine if you should call your getNext() promise.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/shouldGe.name: shouldGetNextPage(at:for:)
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html#/shouldGe.abstract: Trigger utility to determine if a user scrolled to the end of a NSCollectionView. We recommend using this function in your UICollectionViewDelegate collectionView(_:willDisplay:forRepresentedObjectAt:) method to determine if you should call your getNext() promise.

Classes/DKUser/Status.html#/s:11Dropmark.name: active
Classes/DKUser/Status.html#/s:11Dropmark.abstract: A user retains the ability to act within Dropmark

Classes/DKUser/Kind.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.name: owner
Classes/DKUser/Kind.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.abstract: The owner of the collection can add, update, and delete collaborators, as well as alter the collection

Classes/DKUser/Kind.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.name: creator
Classes/DKUser/Kind.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.abstract: The creator originally created the collection, however ownership can be transferred thereafter

Classes/DKUser/Kind.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.name: manager
Classes/DKUser/Kind.html#/s:11DropmarkSD.abstract: A role assigned to users to administer the collection

Classes/DKUser/Kind.html.name: Kind
Classes/DKUser/Kind.html.abstract: When listing collaborators within a collection, a Kind represents a user’s role within the collection

Classes/DKUser/Status.html.name: Status
Classes/DKUser/Status.html.abstract: A user’s ability to act on the Dropmark platform

Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.name: planIsActive
Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.abstract: true if a paid membership is still active

Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.name: storageQuota
Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.abstract: The total amount of storage available for the current user (in bytes)

Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.name: storageUsed
Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.abstract: The amount of storage used by the current user (in bytes)

Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.name: billingEmail
Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.abstract: The primary email address associate with the teams billing account

Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.name: createdAt
Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.abstract: The date the user created their account

Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.name: avatar
Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.abstract: The URL of the user’s avatar image

Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.name: teams
Classes/DKUser.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKU.abstract: A list of all teams of which the user is a member.

Classes/DKUser.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSDK@ob.name: token

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: Content may contain a multitude of types. Usually the content takes the form of a string, which may in turn represent a URL

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: The size in bytes, if applicable, of the content

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: location

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: The date the item was created

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: reactionsTotalCount

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: shortURL
Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: A shortened link to the item on Dropmark. Note: The item must be shareable to view this link.

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: A suite of thumbnails generated by Dropmark

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: true if the content contains a URL. Note: Always test the content yourself, use this only for preview/UI rendering

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: tags
Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: A list of tags applied to this item

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: metadata
Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: Contains a range of other data associated with the item’s content. For example, an image item may contain the image’s EXIF data as a key-value set

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: items
Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: If the item is a stack, this contains a list of child items. Usually this is used to temporarily store up to 4 child items for a quadrant thumbnail, not as a store of all children items.

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: itemsTotalCount
Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: If the item is a stack, this is the total number of child items

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.abstract: The creator of the item

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: reactions

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: comments

Classes/DKItem.html#/s:11DropmarkSDK6DKI.name: directory

Classes/DKCollection/Kind.html#/s:11Drop.name: private

Classes/DKCollection/Kind.html#/s:11Drop.name: public

Classes/DKCollection/Kind.html#/s:11Drop.name: global
Classes/DKCollection/Kind.html#/s:11Drop.abstract: A collection (and it’s items) is publicly available and indexed for search

Classes/DKCollection/Kind.html.name: Kind
Classes/DKCollection/Kind.html.abstract: Privacy of a collection (and it’s items) are determined by the Kind

Classes/DKCollection/SortBy.html.name: SortBy

Classes/DKCollection/SortOrder.html.name: SortOrder
Classes/DKCollection/SortOrder.html.abstract: Render items in an ascending or descending fashion, as dictated by the sortBy variable.

Classes/DKCollection/ViewMode.html.name: ViewMode

Classes/DKCollection.html#/c:@M@Dropmark.abstract: Encodes the receiver using a given archiver.

Classes/DKSession.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSDK.name: user
Classes/DKSession.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSDK.abstract: The user object used to authenticate all network requests during lifetime of the app session. This object must contain a token to authenticate the network requests. A user with the token variable is only returned by the /auth API endpoint.

Classes/DKSession.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSDK.name: apiToken
Classes/DKSession.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSDK.abstract: The token used to authenticate all requests with the Dropmark API. Set this token as soon as the app starts to ensure generated requests are properly authenticated. The variable can be set manually on app launch, or optionally set by a keys.plist file belonging to the target.

Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.name: accessGroup
Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.abstract: Assigns a string to the kSecAttrAccessGroup value in the Keychain query. Recommended if you need to share user credentials between multiple app targets.

Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.name: service
Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.abstract: Assigns a string to the kSecAttrService value in the Keychain query. Used to identify what the Keychain entry is used for.

Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.name: userKey
Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.abstract: Assigns a string to the kSecAttrAccount value in the Keychain query. Used primarily as a key to get the user data from Keychain.

Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.name: baseQuery
Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.abstract: A common set of query parameters used to set, retrieve, and delete

Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.name: user
Classes/DKKeychain.html#/c:@M@DropmarkSD.abstract: The user is stored in the device keychain. Use this variable to securely retrieve the representation of the credentialed user. Note: If the user obect does not contain a token, the user will not be stored.

Classes/DKDateFormatter.html.name: DKDateFormatter
Classes/DKDateFormatter.html.abstract: Custom date formatter corresponds with the Dropmark API formatted date strings

Classes/DKKeychain.html.name: DKKeychain
Classes/DKKeychain.html.abstract: Provides encryption, decryption, and removal of an authenticated user object in the device keychain.

Classes/DKSession.html.name: DKSession
Classes/DKSession.html.abstract: Memory-based storage for credentials within the current app session. Must be reconfigured every time the app leaves memory.

Classes/DKCollection.html.name: DKCollection
Classes/DKCollection.html.abstract: Collections are the main way things are organized in Dropmark. A collection has one owner, but has many items and users (AKA collaborators).

Classes/DKComment.html.name: DKComment
Classes/DKComment.html.abstract: Comments can be added to individual items.

Classes/DKItem.html.name: DKItem
Classes/DKItem.html.abstract: Items belong to a collection, can optionally belong to another item (a stack), and have many comments and reactions.

Classes/DKPermissions.html.name: DKPermissions
Classes/DKPermissions.html.abstract: In a collection, the permissions represent what actions the current user can and cannot perform.

Classes/DKReaction.html.name: DKReaction
Classes/DKReaction.html.abstract: Reactions are essentially a way for a user to “Like” an item.

Classes/DKTag.html.name: DKTag
Classes/DKTag.html.abstract: Tags are added to items and are a great way to organize items across many collections.

Classes/DKTeam.html.name: DKTeam
Classes/DKTeam.html.abstract: Teams are similar to a user account – they have their own username, dashboard and subscription, but a team can be managed by multiple users.

Classes/DKThumbnails.html.name: DKThumbnails
Classes/DKThumbnails.html.abstract: Represents the available thumbnails for a collection or item.

Classes/DKUser.html.name: DKUser
Classes/DKUser.html.abstract: Represents a user on Dropmark. Can be the current user, collaborators, or users external to your team.

Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html.name: DKPagingGenerator
Classes/DKPagingGenerator.html.abstract: Use this class to load consecutive “pages” of content from a listable API endpoint. Includes utilities to check for new content while scrolling in a UICollectionView, UITableView, NSCollectionView, or NSTableView.
